title: jeanluca
author: jeanluca
content: So what I did was, setup a 2 out of 3 multi sig using jade hardware wallets (QR codes). This works great, sending, receiving, no issues.Now I loaded one of the seeds  into a Trezor Safe 3. I thought I could replace one of my jades with this Trezor. However, on the sparrow signing tab (see image)https://orange.surf/content/images/2022/10/multisig-demo-spend-4.pngit is unclear how I should sign with a Trezor. It is connected to my laptop, but signing only seems to work with QR codes. Any suggestions how I can sign with my Trezor ?

This works great, sending, receiving, no issues.Now I loaded one of the seeds  into a Trezor Safe 3. I thought I could replace one of my jades with this Trezor. However, on the sparrow signing tab (see image)it is unclear how I should sign with a Trezor. It is connected to my laptop, but signing only seems to work with QR codes. Any suggestions how I can sign with my Trezor ?Gotta connect the Trezor in Settings > Key stores > connect Trezor. Plug it in with Trezor suite open the xfp should now match!

comments.author: apogio
comments.body: Quote from: jeanluca on December 18, 2024, 09:25:24 PMit is unclear how I should sign with a Trezor. It is connected to my laptop, but signing only seems to work with QR codes. Any suggestions how I can sign with my Trezor ?Normally you just have to press the "Sign" button and it will give you a prompt to "scan" for hardware wallets.Then you will need to plug in your Trezor using the USB and it will find it.Then you will need to press the "Sign" prompt that will appear.It will ask you for your Trezor's PIN and after putting it, you 'll be able to sign.
